meanings.definition: The innermost part of an organ or structure.
meanings.sent1: The medullae of the bone contain important nerves.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the medullae of the brain to understand its functions.
meanings.sent3: The medullae of the fruit were surprisingly sweet.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the medullae of her personality.
meanings.sent5: The medullae of the tree trunk held the key to its growth.

meanings.definition: The plural form of medulla, referring to the innermost part of an organ or structure.
meanings.sent1: They examined the medullae of various organs in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The medullae of the kidneys play a crucial role in filtering blood.
meanings.sent3: The medullae of the flowers were surprisingly vibrant.
meanings.sent4: In the medullae of the city, you could feel its heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The medullae of the mountain contained hidden caves and mysteries.
